meanings.definition: Not parallel; not running alongside or in the same direction
meanings.sent1: The two roads were nonparallel, making it difficult to reach the destination quickly.
meanings.sent2: The nonparallel lines never met, showing they would never run in the same direction.
meanings.sent3: The nonparallel paths of the ants confused the onlookers, leading to a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: Their nonparallel goals made it challenging for them to work together effectively.
meanings.sent5: The nonparallel shadows cast by the trees created a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: Not similar or comparable; lacking similarity or equivalence
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were nonparallel in style, showcasing the artists' unique perspectives.
meanings.sent2: Their opinions were nonparallel, making it hard for them to find common ground.
meanings.sent3: The nonparallel tastes of the siblings led to amusing arguments during dinner.
meanings.sent4: Their nonparallel experiences shaped their contrasting views on life.
meanings.sent5: The nonparallel paths of the rivers symbolized their distinct origins and journeys.
